metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23215 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow leading to a heap-buffer overflow was found in the DwaCompressor of OpenEXR in versions before 3.0.1. An attacker could use this flaw to crash an application compiled with OpenEXR.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23215` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr-3-1-30 - 2.5.7-1
openexr - 2.5.7-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: litios> Patch was also released in v2.5.5

criterions.comment: openexr package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.7-1').
